question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Danone announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. question.title: Will both Coca-Cola and Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both Coca-Cola and Danone announce recalls of any of their products due to metal contamination. Each recall must be officially confirmed by the respective company (Coca-Cola for its products and Danone for its products) or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs for either company within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania hold a referendum on renewable energy initiatives by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both Illinois and Pennsylvania hold referendums on healthcare reform and renewable energy initiatives, respectively, by August 2024?

The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. (b) Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives in the state. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania, and the primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If either of these referendums does not occur or meet the specified criteria by August 31, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

question.body:

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024 (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES only if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Google face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.body:

(b) By August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met by their respective deadlines.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Tennessee enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?

question.title: Will Union Pacific reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Union Pacific implements a new scheduling system for freight train operations and (b) Union Pacific reaches a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability?
question.body:
(a) This component will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, this component will resolve as NO.

(b) This component will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, this component will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both components (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?

The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

(b) Fisker is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives by July 31, 2024. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Fisker's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes.

question.title: Will the Washington Lottery offer online products by July 2024?

question.title: Will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:

2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. If the death toll remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions. question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:

2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. question.title: Will the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?

The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. 1. Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration by August 31, 2024. To qualify:
   - The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   - It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   - The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   - The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

2. Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 31, 2024. This can be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

If neither of these events occurs by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia maintains the current policy stance, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

question.title: Will either a new AI platform be reported for spreading election misinformation or Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to Hispanic-serving universities by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) There are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a new AI platform is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the new AI platform and its role in spreading election misinformation. (b) Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of Hispanic-serving universities. The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these universities. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from an Indiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in San Francisco by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in San Francisco, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a San Francisco rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Indiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional and (b) Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in San Francisco?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) A court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban, with confirmation from an Indiana state court and reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). The 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023. (b) Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in San Francisco, California, with the announcement made by Harris herself during the rally, clearly identifying the individual chosen as her running mate, and confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If either or both of these events do not occur by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Indiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional or (b) Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in San Francisco?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) A court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban. If neither event occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current bird flu outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points and (b) The World Health Organization declares the current bird flu outbreak over?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) At any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. (2) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points (b) The World Health Organization declares the current bird flu outbreak over?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following events occurs:

(a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points at any time between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024. An intraday high is sufficient; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC.

If neither of these events occurs by the specified dates, the question will resolve as NO.
